source.author: Not specified

facts.claim: Claude Code supports up to 7 simultaneous sub-agents for parallel execution
facts.context: Core Concept section discussing parallel execution capabilities

facts.claim: Like programming with threads, explicit orchestration of which steps get delegated to sub-agents yields the best results
facts.context: Key Principles section on orchestration requirements

facts.claim: Claude uses Task agents conservatively unless you provide detailed delegation instructions
Documentation recommends launching parallel Tasks immediately upon requests rather than seeking clarification as the default approach

Recommended 7-step parallel execution model: 1) Component creation, 2) Styling/CSS, 3) Test files, 4) Type definitions, 5) Custom hooks/utilities, 6) Integration (routing, imports, exports), 7) Configuration and documentation updates
facts.context: Workflow Structure section outlining task organization pattern

facts.claim: Group related tasks rather than creating agents for every operation for token efficiency
Remove comments when reading code files for analysis to optimize context
The main agent carries various overheads making it slower than delegated operations

sources.summary: This source provides technical details on Claude Code's Task tool architecture, which supports up to 7 parallel sub-agents. It emphasizes explicit orchestration like thread programming, recommends immediate parallel task launching, and outlines a 7-step workflow model for efficient delegation with token optimization strategies.

source.title: Enabling Claude Code to Work More Autonomously - Anthropic News
source.author: Anthropic

facts.claim: Subagents delegate specialized tasks like spinning up a backend API while the main agent builds the frontend, allowing parallel development workflows
facts.context: Subagents for Parallel Execution feature description

facts.claim: Hooks automatically trigger actions at specific points, such as running your test suite after code changes or linting before commits
Background tasks keep long-running processes like dev servers active without blocking Claude Code's progress on other work
Checkpoint system allows developers to instantly rewind to previous versions by tapping Esc twice or using the /rewind command
Features are powered by Sonnet 4.5 and work in both VS Code extension and terminal interface

sources.summary: Anthropic's official documentation describes Claude Code's autonomous workflow features including subagents for parallel development, hooks for automated actions at specific points, background task support for non-blocking operations, and checkpoint/rewind capabilities. These features are powered by Sonnet 4.5 across VS Code and terminal interfaces.

source.title: How I Use Every Claude Code Feature - SSHH.io Blog
source.author: Not specified

facts.claim: Author uses Claude's built-in Task(...) feature to spawn clones of the general agent for parallel processing rather than creating custom subagents
facts.context: Task Tool for Parallel Execution practical usage

facts.claim: Simple bash scripts that call claude -p in parallel enable large-scale refactors and migrations
facts.context: Key Implementation Strategy for parallel processing

facts.claim: Custom subagents gatekeep context by hiding domain knowledge from the main agent, requiring unnecessary invocations
facts.context: Subagent Architecture Philosophy - issues with custom agents

facts.claim: Custom subagents force rigid workflows that prevent agents from optimizing their own orchestration
facts.context: Subagent Architecture Philosophy explaining workflow limitations

facts.claim: Master-Clone architecture gives main agent complete context via CLAUDE.md and lets it spawn identical clones for specific tasks
In monorepo, baseline context costs approximately 20% of the 200k token window, leaving 180k for actual changes
Use /context mid-session to monitor token usage
facts.context: Context and Token Management best practice

facts.claim: /clear + /catchup workflow restarts sessions with fresh file reading
Document & Clear workflow dumps large tasks to markdown before clearing state
facts.context: Token management workflows for preserving work

facts.claim: Avoid /compact command as it is opaque and error-prone
Use minimal custom slash commands; treat them as shortcuts only, not as mandatory workflow requirements
Treat CLAUDE.md as a high-level, curated set of guardrails rather than comprehensive manual
facts.context: Best Practices Summary on documentation approach

sources.summary: A practitioner's perspective advocating for master-clone architecture over custom subagents to avoid context gatekeeping and rigid workflows. Recommends using built-in Task(...) feature with bash scripts for parallel execution, provides token management strategies (/context, /clear + /catchup, Document & Clear), warns against /compact, and treats CLAUDE.md as high-level guardrails rather than comprehensive documentation.

parallel_execution.workflow_pattern: Launch parallel tasks immediately rather than seeking clarification first
